intro: Eriogonella membranacea, commonly known as the membranous eriogonum, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, which includes buckwheats and sedges. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is characterized by its delicate, membranous leaves. It produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink to red in color. Eriogonella membranacea is often found in open areas such as grasslands and shrublands, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
